player

Class PlayerDataBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • player.PlayerDataBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPlayerDataBase

    public class PlayerDataBase
extends java.util.Observable
implements IPlayerDataBase
    This class will keep track of the players, and who is the current player. Other classes can observe the PlayerDataBase, which will be notified of a TurnEvent at the end of each action.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayerDataBase()
      Creates a new empty PlayerDataBase.

      Returns a list of all the players in the database.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerDataBase

        public PlayerDataBase()
        Creates a new empty PlayerDataBase. To fill the database with players, one has to call createNewDB. Until then the getCurrentPlayer() method will throw an exception.

    • Method Detail

      • createNewDB

        public void createNewDB(java.util.List<SquareContainer> startingPositions)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method creates a new database with players with the specified starting positions. The Players will all have the PlayerState.WAITING state. The order of the players is determined by the specified starting positions list. I.e. the first player allowed to play, is the first player in the list and so on.
        Parameters:
        startingPositions - The startingpositions for the players to create.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The list of starting positions must be valid, i.e. isValidStartingPositionList(List)

      • isValidStartingPositionList

        public boolean isValidStartingPositionList(java.util.List<SquareContainer> startingPositions)
        Returns whether or not the specified startingpositions list is valid. This means:
        • It cannot be null
        • It must contain at least one position
        • There can be no duplicates in the startingpositions
        • All the squares must be a starting position
        Parameters:
        startingPositions - the list to test.
        Returns:
        Whether this is a valid startingpostions list.

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public TronPlayer getCurrentPlayer()
                            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: IPlayerDataBase
        Returns the player who is currently allowed to play.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentPlayer in interface IPlayerDataBase
        Returns:
        the Player who is currently allowed to play.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When the database is empty.

      • getAllPlayers

        public java.util.List<Player> getAllPlayers()
        Returns a list of all the players in the database.
        Returns:
        a list of all the players in the database.

      • getNumberOfPlayers

        public int getNumberOfPlayers()
        The total number of players in the database. Same ad getAllPlayers().size()
        Returns:
        The total number of players in the database.

      • getNumberOfInitialPlayers

        public int getNumberOfInitialPlayers()
        Returns the number of players that initially started in this game.
        Returns:
        The number of players at the start of the game.

      • clearDataBase

        public void clearDataBase()
        Clears the current DB.

      • clearDataBaseAndPlayers

        public void clearDataBaseAndPlayers()
        Clears the current DB. Destroys all the players within so that no-one can use an old Player reference to break the game. This must only be used for tests.

      • removeCurrentPlayer

        public void removeCurrentPlayer()
        The player dies and is removed from the game and disappears. All items he possessed disappear.
